alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Madison; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 8:55AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Madison, northeastern Franklin and eastern Washington Counties through 930 AM CDT... At 855 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of Wesley to 3 miles west of Brentwood. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Fayetteville... Springdale... Huntsville... Farmington... Elkins... West Fork... Greenland... St. Paul... Hindsville... Wesley... Saint Paul... Kingston... Aurora... Brentwood... Japton... Witter... Drake Field Airport... Johnson... Goshen... Georgetown... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 47 and 67. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for northwestern and west central Arkansas.
